description: Art museum morning followed by high-speed travel to Kyoto and evening exploration of historic Pontocho Alley.

activities.description: 🎨 Visit Tokyo National Museum in Ueno - explore Japan's finest art collection including samurai armor, ancient scrolls, and Buddhist sculptures
🏛️ Explore the Honkan (Japanese Gallery) - see national treasures and seasonal special exhibitions
🍱 Lunch at museum café with views of Ueno Park's autumn foliage
🚶 Travel to Tokyo Station - JR Yamanote Line from Ueno (15 minutes)
📍 Navigate to Tokyo Station Shinkansen platforms - follow signs for Tokaido Shinkansen, platforms 14-19

🚅 SHINKANSEN: Board Hikari 517 from Tokyo to Kyoto (14:33 departure) - MUST CATCH for afternoon Kyoto activities! Reserved seats in Car 5. Journey time: 2 hours 15 minutes through stunning Mount Fuji views.
🏮 Arrive Kyoto Station - exit Central Gate and take Karasuma Subway Line to Gion-Shijo (7 minutes)
🚶 Walk to Pontocho Alley - narrow historic lane between Kawaramachi and the Kamogawa River
🏮 Explore Pontocho Alley - traditional wooden machiya houses converted to restaurants and tea houses, look for geisha and maiko
🍶 Dinner at traditional kaiseki restaurant in Pontocho - multi-course seasonal dinner with riverside views
🌙 Evening stroll along Kamogawa River - couples and locals gathering along the riverbank
🏨 Check into Kyoto accommodation and rest for temple adventures tomorrow

transportation: JR Pass valid for Yamanote Line and Shinkansen. Kyoto city bus day pass recommended for tomorrow.
accommodation: Traditional ryokan or modern hotel in central Kyoto
meals: Museum café lunch, traditional kaiseki dinner in Pontocho
notes: CRITICAL: Must catch Hikari 517 at 14:33 - last good connection for afternoon Kyoto arrival. Book kaiseki dinner in advance. Pontocho can be crowded on weekends.
